concise_definition: n. 绕行, 绕道; v. 绕道而行

definitions.explanation_en: A temporary or planned change in a route or path, typically taken to avoid an obstacle, congestion, or closed area, such as a roadblock or construction zone.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为避开障碍物、交通拥堵或封闭区域而临时或计划性地改变原有路线或路径，例如绕行施工区或道路封闭段。
definitions.example_en: Due to the accident, drivers were directed to take a detour through the side streets.
definitions.example_cn: 由于事故，司机被引导通过侧街绕行。

definitions.explanation_en: A departure from the main course or topic, often implying a delay or distraction from the original purpose.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指偏离主要路线或主题，常暗示对原定目标的延误或分心。
definitions.example_en: The meeting took a detour into unrelated personal stories, wasting valuable time.
definitions.example_cn: 会议偏离了主题，转而讨论无关的个人故事，浪费了宝贵时间。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause or force someone or something to take an indirect or alternative route, often temporarily.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指使某人或某物被迫或临时采取一条间接或替代路线。
definitions.example_en: The floodwaters detoured the highway, forcing commuters to find alternate routes.
definitions.example_cn: 洪水使高速公路改道，迫使通勤者寻找其他路线。

definitions.explanation_en: To divert attention or effort away from the original goal or plan, often unintentionally.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指无意中将注意力或精力从原定目标或计划上转移开。
definitions.example_en: The colorful graphics detoured the audience from the core message of the presentation.
definitions.example_cn: 绚丽的图形分散了观众对演示核心信息的注意力。

comparison.analysis: “Diversion” (转移/ diversion) 指将注意力、资源或交通从原定方向转移，常用于更抽象或策略性的语境，如心理上的分心或军事上的佯攻。而 “detour” 更具体地指物理路径的改变，多用于交通或地理场景。
“Reroute” (改道) 是一个更中性、技术性的术语，常用于系统或计划层面的路线调整，如航班改道或导航软件重新规划路径。而 “detour” 常带有临时性、非计划性甚至不便的含义，情感色彩更明显。
“Side trip” (顺道游览) 指主动、自愿地偏离主路线去参观或探索某个地方，通常带有积极或休闲的目的。而 “detour” 多为被迫或必要之举，常伴随不便或延误，情感上更中性或负面。
